title: Former Aetna CEO Says He Is Being Pushed Off CVS Board
summary: Former chief executive of Aetna says he is being forced off of CVS's board. CVS Health Corp.'s announcement Monday that former Aetna Inc. Chief Executive Mark Bertolini will leave the CVS board exposed tensions underlying one of the biggest U.S. health-care mergers.

title: Tuesday Night Trump
summary: In between personal insults, a 'relentlessly optimistic' State of the Union.. In the 133 days since Nancy Pelosi launched her impeachment via press conference, Democrats have enjoyed a political environment skewed to a question that has kept the president and his supporters on defense: Is Donald Trump so unfit for office that Congress needs to remove him?

title: China Is the Real Sick Man of Asia
summary: Its financial markets may be even more dangerous than its wildlife markets.. The mighty Chinese juggernaut has been humbled this week, apparently by a species-hopping bat virus. While Chinese authorities struggle to control the epidemic and restart their economy, a world that has grown accustomed to contemplating China's inexorable rise was reminded that nothing, not even Beijing's power, can be taken for granted.

title: Shut Up, They Advised
summary: A committee on judicial standards ignores the Constitution to rule against the Federalist Society.. At a time the First Amendment rights of free speech and association are under assault, it's disheartening to see the judiciary getting in on the act. At issue are the judge-made rules governing judges themselves. A draft advisory opinion circulated last month by the Committee on Codes of Conduct of the U.S. Judicial Conference recommends new restrictions on the First Amendment rights of federal judges as well as their law clerks and staff attorneys. The opinion is unconstitutional, and a sloppy bit of judging to boot.

title: Democrats Are Lying About My Argument
summary: Their false narrative of impeachment could set a dangerous precedent.. Democrats tried to put me on trial in the Senate last week, denouncing what they called "the Dershowitz doctrine." Rep. Adam Schiff claimed I advocated a "lawless" variation on Richard Nixon's view that "when the president does it, that means that it is not illegal." Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer said that under my "doctrine" Nixon didn't commit any impeachable offense-never mind his numerous crimes and my explicit statement that I supported Nixon's impeachment. Pundits went further: Joe Lockhart, former press secretary to President Clinton, said: "This is what you hear from Stalin . . . from Hitler, from all the authoritarian people who rationalized, in some cases, genocide."

title: The Truth About the 'Public Charge' Immigration Rule
summary: Trump's regulation is a response to a real problem, and it's nowhere near as draconian as critics say.. The Supreme Court last week lifted a nationwide injunction against Trump administration regulations imposing tougher standards for aliens attempting to prove that they won't become "public charges." Under the old guidelines, established during the Clinton era, only cash assistance or long-term institutional care could be considered strikes against applicants. Only a few hundred applicants were refused under the public charge provision world-wide each year.

title: VA's Deputy Secretary Dismissed by Department's Top Official
summary: Spokesman said VA Secretary Robert Wilkie lost confidence in James Byrne, but wouldn't specify why. Department of Veterans Affairs Secretary Robert Wilkie fired his deputy, citing a loss in confidence in James Byrne's ability to carry out his duties.

title: A Walk With Homer Is an Earbud Odyssey
summary: Nothing compares to hearing an epic text read by a great actor.. Walking in the forest, I had to stop and mop my eyes. People were approaching, so I pretended to be preoccupied. Once they'd passed, I tapped the Audible app on my iPhone and went straight back to Erebus, where Odysseus had shocked me into tears with his own shock at meeting his mother.

summary: Irene Morgan, 27, kept her seat on a Greyhound bus in 1944. She went all the way to the Supreme Court.. Saluda, Va.

title: Turkey Launches Strikes on Syria After Military Personnel Are Killed
summary: President Erdogan pledges to defend Turkey's interests, but Monday's reprisals could shake his fragile alliance with Russia. Turkey launched ground and air attacks on Syrian troops after eight of its military personnel were killed in Syrian shelling in the north of the war-torn country, jeopardizing Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's fragile security pact with Damascus's main ally, Russia.

title: Expatriate Iowans Caucus in Paris

summary: Defense lawyers question the aspiring actress about her relationship with Mr. Weinstein, including emails she sent him. Harvey Weinstein's defense team spent hours Monday questioning a former actress who accused him of rape in sometimes combative exchanges, trying to undercut her story and highlight her yearslong relationship with him.

title: How Coronavirus Could Disrupt the Auditing of Companies
summary: Auditors could have trouble completing inventory count or other key aspects of the balance sheet, legal and audit experts say. Travel restrictions related to the coronavirus outbreak could limit the work of external auditors, possibly leading to incomplete reports, late corporate filings or last-minute scrambles for deadline extensions, securities lawyers and former regulators say.

title: Genetic Scoring Presents Opportunity, Peril
summary: Polygenic scores only reflect the particular group of people studied in a particular time and place in which they lived. This means that polygenic scores can and do reflect racism, sexism or other prejudices, as well as more benign environmental factors.. As researchers with expertise in polygenic scores, we write to express concern that Charles Murray's attempt to explain how "Genetics Will Revolutionize Social Science" (op-ed, Jan. 28) will likely invite confusion about the nature and potential of polygenic scores.

title: Private Practice Is Solution for M.D. Burnout
summary: I announced to all my patients, and to all the government/insurance entities, that I was quitting all relationships with all third-party payment systems.. As I read the letters from physicians regarding "Why So Many Midcareer Doctors Burn Out" (Letters, Jan. 27), it is apparent that many of the physicians haven't considered taking a fundamental step that saved my own career and my patients from an early retirement from primary-care internal medicine. The list of problems generated in doctors' practices from the government (Medicare, Medicaid) and from insurance companies is endless, and no one physician can possibly battle such an overwhelming armada of forces that routinely creates roadblocks for decent care. As the primary-care-doctor shortage worsens every year, this has become a critical matter for the health care of our country.

title: Rational Labor Rules Help Jobs and Growth
summary: There are signs that GDP growth now is poised to accelerate in our "fully grown," but still vibrant, economy.. Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney and Secretary of Labor Eugene Scalia tout the Labor Department's "joint employer" rule as the latest in a long list of deregulatory wins for the Trump administration ("Making Labor Rules Rational Again," op-ed, Jan. 13). The new rule codifies standards for determining a company's joint-employer status with regard to contract workers, thereby clarifying the point at which the contracting company becomes an employer and is responsible for ensuring workers receive the minimum wage and overtime pay. Substantial compliance costs also are absorbed by the contracting company when it is deemed a joint employer.

title: Democratic Candidates and Turning Out Black Voters

title: Forever 21 Unveils Deal to Sell to Mall Owners
summary: Simon Property, Brookfield Property and Authentic Brands will pay $81 million for retailer, subject to rival bids at bankruptcy auction. Forever 21 Inc. reached a deal Sunday to sell the retail chain to a consortium of buyers including landlords Simon Property Group Inc., Brookfield Property Partners LP and Authentic Brands Group LLC for $81 million.

title: New York City Investigating Three Possible Cases of Coronavirus
summary: All three had recently been in China. New York City officials are awaiting test results on three suspected cases of coronavirus and preparing for the possibility of quarantining visitors traveling from China and arriving at John F. Kennedy International Airport.

title: Jeff Bezos Sued for Defamation by Girlfriend's Brother
summary: Michael Sanchez says the Amazon.com founder and a security expert spread a false rumor he leaked nude photos to the National Enquirer. Michael Sanchez, the brother of Jeff Bezos' girlfriend, sued the Amazon.com Inc. founder for defamation, alleging his representatives spread false rumors to news outlets that Mr. Sanchez provided graphic nude photos of Mr. Bezos to the press.

title: Hong Kong Hospital Workers to Strike Over Coronavirus
summary: Organized labor wants the territory to shut its borders to mainland China. Thousands of Hong Kong hospital workers voted to press ahead with a five-day strike starting Monday, kicking off a bid by organized labor to force the government to fully shut its borders to mainland China as cases of the deadly coronavirus tick up in the territory.

title: Experts Race to Figure Out How Contagious the Coronavirus Is
summary: The outbreak of novel coronavirus appears more contagious than seasonal flu and is on par with SARS in 2002 and 2003, studies say. BEIJING-Public-health experts around the world have been crunching numbers about the advance of China's dangerous new coronavirus to estimate how far and fast it could spread.

title: Trump, Democrats Press Their Case as Impeachment Nears Its End
summary: Likely acquittal this week has the president looking ahead to November. WASHINGTON-An emboldened President Trump turned his focus Sunday to his re-election bid, arguing a growing economy would help him in November, as Democrats' lead impeachment manager vowed to press for the president's removal even as the Senate is virtually certain to acquit him.

title: Coronavirus Kills Its First Victim Outside China as Toll Grows
summary: The Pentagon sets up quarantine centers as the U.S. count of people sickened climbs to eight. The newly identified coronavirus claimed its first life outside China, as the number of U.S. cases ticked up to eight and the Pentagon said it was setting up quarantine centers for travelers who screened positive for the illness.

title: WeWork Parent Names Sandeep Mathrani New CEO
summary: SoftBank's Marcelo Claure to remain We executive chairman. WeWork has taken its first significant step in the post-Adam Neumann era, naming a new chief executive officer to run a company whose challenges abound.

title: Cuomo's Penn Station Plans Echo Robert Moses
summary: Clause in budget legislation would pave way for state to use eminent domain. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's latest plan to redevelop Pennsylvania Station shows he really has become a 21st century Robert Moses-not just in dreaming big about infrastructure, but in tugging every available lever of power to move projects along.
